question: ethiopia flight 961 crashes in to the sea
vanilla_rag_result:
Ethiopian Airlines Flight 961 was a scheduled flight from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to Nairobi, Kenya, that was hijacked on November 23, 1996. The hijackers, armed with knives, demanded to be flown to Australia. After a series of failed negotiations and attempts to land, the aircraft ran out of fuel and crashed into the Indian Ocean near the Comoros Islands. Of the 175 people on board, 50 survived the crash, while the rest perished. The incident highlighted issues related to airline security and the dangers of hijacking.
